meanings.definition: A person who has an extreme or irrational fear of crowded spaces or open areas.
meanings.sent1: The agoraphobic felt anxious when surrounded by a large crowd.
meanings.sent2: She avoided going to the park because she was agoraphobic.
meanings.sent3: The agoraphobic joked that they would rather face a lion than a busy street.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of open spaces made her feel like an agoraphobic trapped in a cage.
meanings.sent5: The agoraphobic's heart raced as they stepped outside into the bustling city.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of agoraphobia.
meanings.sent1: The therapist recommended a treatment plan for her agoraphobic symptoms.
meanings.sent2: His agoraphobic tendencies made it challenging for him to leave the house.
meanings.sent3: The agoraphobic cat refused to venture beyond the safety of the living room.
meanings.sent4: The agoraphobic clouds seemed to loom over the horizon, blocking out the sun.
meanings.sent5: The agoraphobic behavior of the character added depth to the story.
